name: House Finch
description: Male coloration ranges from yellow to red depending on the amount of carotenoids in their diet.
spread_note: Originally lived only in the western USA and Mexico, but in the 1940s, birds were introduced to northern areas and now occur as far as southern Canada.
image_alt: House finch, photo: Prague Zoo archive
proportions: Body length 6.5–9.5 cm; tail length 5.8–6.5 cm; wing length 7.7–8.2 cm; weight 19–24 g
attractions: Adult birds feed mainly on flowers, buds, and tree sap, while parents primarily feed chicks with seeds.
breeding: At Prague Zoo, we have kept and successfully bred house finches since 1991.
